answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!In all probability this was due to low blood sugar. You must keep glucose or a sweetened drink handy to drink in such times. Also you must inform your doctor and probably change the timing or dose of medication.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!
This happens to me to, it could just mean that you got up to fast or your not eating well or your diet has changed. It is also a possibilitie of high or low blood sugar.

question: Last night I got up to go to the bathroom, and when I stood up, I became very dizzy, was very nauseated, and broke out into a complete body sweat.  This last for approximately 15 minutes, and then the symptoms slowly went away.  I thought I had to vomit, but when I intentionally tried to vomit, nothing happened.  I have type 2 diabetes and currently take Janumet twice a day.  Could this have been low blood sugar, or high blood sugar?
title: Nausea and dizziness
